item.title: New Epstein documents reveal details about his friendship with former prince Andrew
item.description: The royal family faces a fresh round of embarrassment after the latest tranche of Epstein files reveal unsavoury details about the convicted sex offender's relationship with Andrew.

item.title: Author Shailee Thompson merges horror and romance in debut novel
item.description: Debut author Shailee Thompson's new novel How to Kill a Guy in Ten Dates follows cinephile Jamie Prescott, who has to rely on her extensive knowledge of what not to do in a slasher situation when a speed-dating event she attends turns deadly.

item.title: Tasty lunch-box recipes to make the back-to-school weeks easier
item.description: As kids head back into classrooms, we've put together some recipes to help their school lunch boxes come home empty.

item.title: Rockhampton gathers for walk against violence after alleged rape of female runner
item.description: The Rockhampton community comes together in a show of emotional support after a young woman was allegedly sexually assaulted and nearly drowned by a stranger on a walking track.

item.title: Liberal frontbenchers dismiss prospect of imminent challenge to Sussan Ley
item.description: Shadow treasurer Ted O'Brien says it is his "assumption" that Liberal frontbencher Angus Taylor still supports Sussan Ley, despite days of speculation that he's planning to challenge for the leadership.

item.title: Trump administration eyes US Pacific territories as it moves towards deep-sea mining
item.description: A Trump administration push to begin deep-sea mining is gathering momentum — and stirring alarm in United States Pacific territories.

item.title: Australian Open 2026 final: Carlos Alcaraz, Novak Djokovic meet in titanic battle of generational greats
item.description: More tennis history will go on the line when Novak Djokovic and Carlos Alcaraz clash in an Australian Open final of the highest stakes.

item.title: A summer of extremes unfolded across Western Australia in January 2026 — see the photos
item.description: From bushfires and chaotic scenes, to moments of serenity, January 2026 captured Western Australia in all its extremes.

item.title: A 'chia seed' trend on TikTok promotes a 'quick fix' to weight loss, but is it safe?
item.description: The health benefits of chia seeds have been well publicised, but health and internet experts are urging people to not believe everything you see on social media.

item.title: Risso's and pantropical spotted dolphins seen off Port Macquarie
item.description: Deepwater dolphin species make a rare appearance on the NSW Mid North Coast, delighting scientists and marine wildlife enthusiasts.

item.title: Inside the brand strategy behind the Beckham family drama — and who controls the narrative now
item.description: In a modern crisis, experts say control doesn't always come from speaking louder — but from knowing when, where and how briefly to speak at all.

item.title: Half of Adelaide University's Magill campus to be sold for housing, retirement units, aged care
item.description: South Australia's premier announces the future of Adelaide University's Magill campus, which sits on the boundary of two marginal Liberal-held electorates.

item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Australian Open champion Elena Rybakina eyeing more success after victory over Aryna Sabalenka
item.description: Newly-crowned Australian Open champion Elena Rybakina isn't content with a second grand slam title following a rampant run through the Melbourne Park draw.

item.title: Lily Allen has made a huge comeback — soon she'll be in Australia
item.description: The British singer made her triumphant return to the annual countdown with two tracks from her latest album West End Girl.

item.title: 'Job finished' for Carlos Alcaraz as he wins first Australian Open
item.description: Carlos Alcaraz is the youngest man to complete the career Grand Slam, beating 24-time major winner Novak Djokovic in the Australian Open final.

item.title: Matildas legend Sarah Walsh says South Korea boycott would be 'devastating' for Asian Cup
item.description: Asian Cup organisers say they are hopeful the South Korean women's team will partake in next month's tournament despite threats of a boycott due to "harsh and unreasonable conditions" under the nation's federation.

item.title: Alex Volkanovski retains featherweight championship with decision victory over Diego Lopes at UFC 325
item.description: Alex Volkanovski's win over Diego Lopes at UFC 325 was enough to retain the world featherweight title and give Australia's greatest ever MMA fighter and his fans exactly what they were looking for.

item.title: Pakistan spinner Usman Tariq dismisses Australia's Cameron Green's gesture about his action in second T20I
item.description: Pakistan spinner Usman Tariq responds after Cameron Green appeared to mimic his action in Australia's comprehensive T20 loss in Lahore.

item.title: The Grammys are on Monday morning — here's how to watch and who to look out for
item.description: From Kendrick Lamar to Lady Gaga, here are all the nominees and performers to look out for at the Grammys this year.

item.title: Clive Palmer rejects Steve Bannon influence claim in latest Epstein files
item.description: Clive Palmer denies newly surfaced claims that his 2019 federal election campaign was influenced by a senior advisor to US President Donald Trump.

item.title: Carlos Alcaraz has his never-before moment by beating Novak Djokovic in his own house
item.description: Carlos Alcaraz has defeated Novak Djokovic in a pulsating Australian Open final, becoming the youngest man with a career Grand Slam in the process.

item.title: Novak Djokovic drops retirement hint, suggests 2026 could be his final Australian Open
item.description: Novak Djokovic did not go into detail on what he meant, nor did he confirm a plan to retire this year, but he chose his words carefully on centre court.

item.title: 'Strong possibility' fugitive Dezi Freeman is dead in Mount Buffalo National Park as new search begins
item.description: Victoria Police will spend five days scouring a remote section of Mount Buffalo National Park in the state's north-east as part of a renewed search for fugitive Dezi Freeman.

item.title: Where in your home is best to set up a work space?
item.description: From garages to cupboards, we asked experts on things to consider before you choose where to set up a home office.

item.title: Property prices expected to slow as forecast RBA interest rate hike dampens growth
item.description: Property prices rose across the country in January, but analysts expect the pace of growth to slow as forecast rate hikes put off prospective buyers.

item.title: The economy should be the focus but Coalition incompetence is a gift to Labor
item.description: The trip to the tennis is a sign of the PM's own sense of confidence. It's a move that is only made by a man who clearly has his mojo back.

item.title: Unnecessary interest rate cuts derailed the national housing affordability project
item.description: The great unspoken truth about central banking and monetary policy is that while it's aimed at consumer prices, its most direct impact is on house prices, which are arguably the most important prices of all.

item.title: David Littleproud to survive spill, but Sussan Ley’s future uncertain
item.description: Leadership speculation has engulfed both the Liberal and National parties since the minor party walked away from the Coalition agreement two weeks ago.

item.title: Novak Djokovic praises Carlos Alcaraz after Spaniard wins first Australian Open title
item.description: Despite the hollow feeling of defeat, 24-time major winner Novak Djokovic heaps praise on Carlos Alcaraz following the Spaniard's history-making Australian Open victory.

item.title: Alcaraz and Djokovic thrill Rafa and a 'boring' heckle delights Rod Laver Arena — quick hits from the Australian Open men's final
item.description: Rafael Nadal gives his seal of approval and Novak Djokovic collects the one trophy missing from his cabinet as his Melbourne Park fortunes flip. Here are the quick hits from the Australian Open.

item.title: 'Cynical and targeted' Russian strike on Ukrainian bus kills 12
item.description: A series of attacks across Ukraine comes ahead of US-brokered trilateral talks between Ukraine and Russia set for the coming week.

item.title: Can your dog read your next move? These are the cues they use
item.description: Your dog is constantly reading you and using it to their advantage. These are the cues they use to foresee your next move.

item.title: Australia suffers heaviest T20 defeat, Pakistan to boycott World Cup match against India
item.description: Australia slumps to a 3-0 T20 series defeat in Pakistan, leading into this month's World Cup.

item.title: Fossilised dinosaur footprint identified after more than 60 years in palaeontologist's collection
item.description: A fossilised dinosaur footprint that lived in a professor's personal collection for more than six decades is identified.

item.title: ASX swept into global sell-off as gold miners tumble on precious metals rout — as it happened
item.description: The ASX has had its biggest fall since November, led by hefty falls for gold miners as the precious metals rout continued. See how the session unfolded plus insights from our business reporters on the ABC News markets blog.

item.title: Littleproud to meet with Ley after seeing off leadership challenge — as it happened
item.description: Nationals leader David Littleproud is set to meet with opposition leader Sussan Ley after seeing off a leadership challenge.

item.title: Mary Fowler returns to the pitch as Manchester City hammer Chelsea in Women's Super League
item.description: Matildas star Mary Fowler returns to football after a nine-and-a-half-month injury lay-off, as Manchester City thumps Chelsea in the Women's Super League.

item.title: Nightcliff Tigers premiership player sues AFL over 'catastrophic' concussion
item.description: Nightcliff Tigers dual-premiership player Trent Melville is suing the AFL in the NT Supreme Court after suffering "catastrophic injuries" in a head clash with another player in 2022.

item.title: Arsenal wins FIFA Women's Champions Cup as Matilda Caitlin Foord scores winning goal
item.description: Arsenal have become the first women's world soccer champions, with Matildas star Caitlin Foord clinching the title for the Gunners in extra time.

item.description: Wildlife volunteers in WA's South West are urging people to get involved in caring for hundreds of baby swans found abandoned over summer.

item.title: Will the RBA increase interest rates today?
item.description: The market thinks the RBA is likely to lift interest rates on Tuesday, but the market has been wrong before.

item.title: US Deputy Attorney-General says further charges from Epstein files unlikely
item.description: Deputy Attorney-General Todd Blanche says the existence of "horrible photographs" and troubling emails in the latest cache of released files does not necessarily mean prosecutions can go ahead.

item.title: Police investigate alleged sexual assault of boy in Adelaide park toilet
item.description: Police say a teenage boy was sexually assaulted at a toilet block in Adelaide's south on Saturday by another young male who had asked for help to "look for his lost mobile phone".

item.description: Debí Tirar Más Fotos is the first Spanish-language record to win Album of the Year at the Grammy awards.

item.description: The best and most memorable red carpet looks at the 68th Annual Grammy Awards.

item.title: Today in History, February 2: Balto and the dogs of 1925's Great Serum Run
item.description: Children of an icebound Alaskan town were dying. The journey to save them would be treacherous, freezing, and in these dogs' paws.

item.title: From Sabalenka to Djokovic and 'animals in the zoo', here are the best quotes from the Australian Open 2026
item.description: From tennis stars pushing for more privacy, to Djokovic saying he feels like an old man and a Kyrgios F-bomb, there have been some funny and weird quotes at this year's Australian Open.

item.title: Liam Conejo Ramos returns to Minnesota after being detained by ICE on way home from preschool
item.description: Five-year-old Liam Conejo Ramos, whose detention by federal agents as he returned from preschool sparked outrage across the United States, has been released from immigration detention, according to a US congressman.

item.title: Australian monobob star Bree Walker welcomes pressure at 2026 Winter Olympic Games
item.description: The g-force felt hurtling down the bobsleigh track is the only pressure Bree Walker is feeling despite the Australian speed demon entering the Winter Olympics as one of the gold-medal favourites.

item.title: Grammy winners 2026: Bad Bunny takes home Album of The Year, Olivia Dean Best New Artist
item.description: The 68th Grammy Awards main ceremony has happened in Lose Angeles. See who won what here.

item.title: Youth homelessness leaves 'huge hidden population' seeking safety at school
item.description: A coalition calls for action to help the "huge hidden population" of young people in Western Australia who are experiencing homelessness, with children left feeling ashamed and alone even in the safety of school.

item.title: Norwegian rape trial rocks the royal family and grips the public
item.description: This week, Marius Borg Høiby, the stepson of Norway's future king, will face trial on a string of rape, drug and abuse charges, and it has the whole country talking.

item.title: Cleveland man charged over death of three-week-old baby south of Brisbane in 2024
item.description: Police have charged a man with murder over the death of a newborn baby south of Brisbane more than 18 months ago.

item.title: Former Queensland Origin player Joshua McGuire's child assault case before Brisbane court
item.description: The case against a former Queensland State of Origin player accused of assaulting a child has come before a court for the first time.

item.title: Corporate Travel Management founder Jamie Pherous resigns amid overcharging scandal
item.description: Corporate Travel Management boss Jamie Pherous has exited from all his executive and board roles as he moves to a "strategic advisory role."

item.title: Found a PCOS 'cure' on social media? It might not be for you
item.description: Advice on how to "manage", "treat" and "heal" PCOS is easy to come by online, but experts say a more personalised approach is usually what's needed.

item.title: 'Lucky' fishermen rescued after boat fire near Binalong Bay, Tasmania
item.description: Two boaties stranded at sea for eight hours after their tinnie caught fire chose a survival plan police described as "highly unrecommended" — to set it on fire again.

item.title: Grammys 2026: Bad Bunny, Billie Eilish slam ICE at music's biggest awards
item.description: The 2026 Grammys blended protest, celebration and cultural change as artists confronted powers that be, embraced diversity and reshaped the night's biggest awards.

item.title: TasWater's proposed 8.8 per cent bill increase knocked back by regulator
item.description: Tasmanian households have dodged a bullet, with the state's economic regulator refusing TasWater's proposed annual fee hikes of 8.8 per cent for the next four years.

item.title: Boy, 13, makes 'superhuman' swim to save family swept out to sea in Geographe Bay
item.description: A 13-year-old boy has been hailed a hero after swimming four hours through rough seas to get help for his mother and two siblings, who were swept out to sea on an inflatable paddleboard in WA's South West.

item.title: Epstein files suggest Mandelson kept paedophile informed on Rudd's mining super profits tax
item.description: Newly released documents show British Labour peer Peter Mandelson kept sex trafficking paedophile Jeffrey Epstein informed about the campaign against Kevin Rudd's proposed mining tax.

item.title: Wadeye traditional owners worry community violence is escalating
item.description: Traditional owners from the NT's second largest Indigenous community Wadeye are appealing for more support to end a month of attacks on houses, and fights involving up to 100 armed people in the streets.

item.title: Mosman Park suspected double murder-suicide prompts calls for greater support for families with high-needs children
item.description: A suspected murder-suicide in Perth has put the spotlight on families with high needs children, with speculation that the Clune family were not getting the support they needed in the lead up to their deaths.

item.title: Australia's Cam Myers becomes youngest ever winner of Wanamaker Mile indoor race in New York
item.description: Australia's Cam Myers becomes the youngest ever winner of the prestigious Wanamaker Mile, with the 19-year-old powering to victory in New York.

item.title: Slain police officer Neal Thompson's sister says death would be 'too good' for Dezi Freeman
item.description: The sister of one of the police officers shot dead in Victoria's high country last year tells the ABC that death would be "too good" an outcome for the accused gunman Dezi Freeman.

item.title: Monday Finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Police granted Julian Ingram bail despite safety concerns, court documents reveal
item.description: Accused triple-murderer Julian Ingram was granted bail by police despite concerns being raised over the safety of potential victims and the community. The 37-year-old remains on the run from police.

item.title: WA to launches trial of free full-time kindergarten at five public schools. Here's how it works
item.description: As WA kids headed back to the classroom after summer holidays, five of the state's public schools begin a trial of free full-time kindergarten.

item.title: Properties under threat as uncontrolled Deep Creek bushfire burns south of Adelaide
item.description: An Emergency Warning has been issued for people in the area of a fast-moving, uncontrolled bushfire burning near Cape Jervis, south of Adelaide.

item.title: Ley and Littleproud hold 'civil' talks but yet to agree terms for Coalition reunion
item.description: The federal Liberal and National leaders held eleventh-hour crisis talks after David Littleproud survived an unlikely challenge from as disgruntled backbencher.

item.title: Is Dezi Freeman dead?
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: WA man to serve at least 21 years in jail for 'brutal' murder of father
item.description: A man who committed a "horrific" attack on his father in regional WA, recording some of it and posting it online, will have to serve at least 21 years for murder.

item.title: Cory Bernardi to contest SA state election for One Nation
item.description: Former federal Liberal senator Cory Bernardi will lead One Nation's Legislative Council ticket at the upcoming state election in South Australia.

item.title: Katherine River peaks just below flood levels, with more rain on the way
item.description: The Katherine River peaked just below the minor flood level on Monday, but the Bureau of Meteorology says the situation could change with more rain expected in coming days.

item.title: Sarah Court to be first female head of ASIC, Treasurer Jim Chalmers announces
item.description: This position will give Ms Court significant influence over Australian corporate culture.

item.title: Dalai Lama's Grammy win slammed as 'anti-China' by Chinese government
item.description: The 90-year-old, who lives in exile from his Tibetan homeland, says he accepts the award with "gratitude and humility" but it has sparked a furious response from China.

item.title: Trump administration to unveil rare-earths mineral stockpile to counter China
item.description: A $US12 billion ($17.2 billion) investment from the US Export-Import Bank is attracting attention from major American car companies, and comes as Washington seeks to break China's dominance of resources key for military and computing applications.

item.title: Sarah Ferguson called Epstein a 'legend', told him to 'just marry me', new emails show
item.description: The former Duchess of York's friendship with the late sex offender is back in the spotlight after the latest release of documents about the Epstein case.

item.title: Donald Trump announces trade deal between US and India with tariffs slashed
item.description: The US president says his social media platform that a deal had been struck, which includes a reduction of tariffs on Indian products in exchange for New Delhi no longer buying oil from Russia.

item.title: Brisbane baby coffee assault tests Australia-China relations
item.description: Sixteen months after a stranger poured scalding coffee over a baby in a Brisbane park, China's decision to send a working group to Australia marks the first tangible shift in a complicated case.

item.title: In Antarctica's hostile environment, survival experts keep people safe
item.description: Antarctica can be a dangerous place to live and work, but to mitigate the risks, a team of survival specialists is contracted to keep Australia's expeditioners safe on the ice.

item.title: Travel quiz, February 3: Can you work your way around the world with these questions?
item.description: Where is Burning Man held each year? And which of these attractions is the tallest?

item.title: How decluttering your digital streaming subscriptions can save you money this year
item.description: With Australian households now holding an average of 3.7 digital entertainment subscriptions each, doing an audit on what you're using and whether it's providing value can be a good place to start when looking to cut costs.

item.title: One Nation condemned for 'spot the Westerner' video
item.description: A One Nation party official has filmed strangers on Melbourne's streets claiming the city "doesn't look like a Western nation at all".

item.title: If the Reserve Bank starts the year with a rate hike, you can't say it didn't warn us
item.description: Could RBA economists conceivably see inflation returning to target without a rate hike? We'll know this afternoon, and while it's not the dominant view, it's not a fringe one, either.

item.title: Should I take a fish oil supplement for my heart, joints or mood?
item.description: Fish oil is one of the most popular dietary supplements. It's often promoted for protecting the heart, boosting mood, reducing inflammation, and supporting overall health.

item.title: Amber Wraith's parents say medical professionals dismissed her suicidal thoughts
item.description: A hospital has apologised to the parents of 19-year-old Amber Wraith, who took her own life in 2022. Her family hopes her death will prompt changes in the way mental health patients are treated.

item.title: Dezi Freeman search continues as Victoria Police vow hunt 'will not stop'
item.description: Victoria Police is continuing to search bushland in the Mount Buffalo National Park for traces of alleged gunman Dezi Freeman.

item.title: Panic selling hits gold as analysts warn of potential 'regime change' in financial markets
item.description: The precious metals market collapses following the appointment of new US Federal Reserve chair Kevin Warsh, and some analysts say it signals a significant shift in the world's financial markets.

item.title: Where do you spend your money? Tell us
item.description: We are keen to understand how the cost of living is being felt across Australia. What are your biggest expenses? Are you making cutbacks? Do you afford yourself luxuries?

item.title: Kangaroo Island's sea lions.
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Citizen scientists look for hope as the algal bloom persists
item.description: On Kangaroo Island – where the bloom has washed death ashore for almost a year – a group of citizen scientists are focusing their efforts on "what’s still out there".

item.title: Australian Climate and Homelessness Alliance to help rough sleepers through extreme weather
item.description: Tim knows firsthand the struggles of being homeless and navigating the weather, but it's experiences like his which will be the focus of a newly formed Australian Climate and Homelessness Alliance.

item.title: Victorian GPs to be trained to diagnose and treat ADHD in adults and children
item.description: General practitioners in Victoria will soon be able to diagnose and treat ADHD in adults and children in a move the state government says will cut lengthy wait times and save thousands of dollars.

item.title: Josh Hazlewood to miss start of T20 World Cup, Mitch Marsh shrugs off Pakistan loss
item.description: Speedster Josh Hazlewood will miss the early stages of the T20 World Cup as captain Mitch Marsh shrugs off Australia's lamentable capitulations in their warm-up series in Pakistan.

item.title: Children with brain cancer given hope in trial of personalised vaccines across eight Australian hospitals
item.description: The four-year trial of about 70 children with "dismal prognoses" in eight hospitals across Australia will test the safety and effectiveness of the experimental treatment designed to harness the immune system to attack a child's tumour.

item.title: ACT election data suggests neither Liberal nor Greens voters would want a coalition between the parties
item.description: Greens voters overwhelmingly preference Labor over the Liberal Party across the country — and a look at the data from the 2024 ACT election suggests there's no reason to think that would be different in Canberra.

item.title: High Court to consider if Victoria's strict cap on individual political donations is discriminatory
item.description: Two independent Victorian political candidates will ask the High Court to overturn a state law capping political donations to just under $5,000 but allowing an exception for the major parties.

item.title: Nationals sit on crossbench as PM grilled on cost of living — as it happened
item.description: The Nationals have taken their seats on the crossbench in Question Time in the House of Representatives as the prime minister is grilled on the cost of living.

item.title: Sita Walker's debut novel, In a Common Hour, takes place across a single hour at a state high school
item.description: Sita Walker, an English teacher from Brisbane, explains how she tackled her first work of fiction, set in a single hour at a state high school.

item.title: Spanish figure skater Tomas-Llorenc Guarino Sabate says Minions music barred due to copyright issue
item.description: Spanish figure skater Tomas-Llorenc Guarino Sabate says he will not be allowed to use the music from the Minions film franchise that he has skated to throughout the season at the Milano Cortina Games due to a copyright clearance issue.

item.title: Seaspray beach residents push back on wind farm turbines 10km from shore
item.description: A tiny coastal community in Victoria's east is battling an international wind energy giant that wants to build 60 to 70 turbines in the ocean 10 kilometres from shore.

item.title: Aussie dollar climbs as RBA raises rates and leaves door open to more hikes — as it happened
item.description: The Reserve Bank has hiked the cash rate 0.25 percentage points to 3.85 per cent, in its first rate rise in more than two years. The Aussie dollar rose back above 70 US cents after the decision.

item.title: Deep Creek fire remains uncontrolled after nearing caravan park
item.description: A bushfire on South Australia's Fleurieu Peninsula has had its warning level again downgraded, but the Country Fire Service says it has burned more than 1,900 hectares and remains uncontrolled.

item.title: Behind the music of hit Australian indie game Hollow Knight: Silksong
item.description: The video game soundtrack will be performed live for the first time by Orchestra Victoria at ACMI in February.

item.title: Townsville health authorities report rise in pregnant women drinking
item.description: A sharp rise in pregnant women drinking alcohol in Australia's largest northern city might be linked to the impact of last year's floods, health authorities say.

item.title: Tributes flow for long-time ABC host James Valentine after cancer forces retirement
item.description: Listeners and former colleagues share treasured memories of a veteran broadcaster who has announced his retirement due to cancer.

item.title: Belinda Bencic and Elina Svitolina make history as two mothers sit in WTA top 10 for the first time
item.description: For the first time in women's tennis, two mothers are ranked inside the world's top 10 simultaneously.

item.title: Denmark volunteers unite for coastal rehabilitation in wake of destructive tourist season
item.description: Volunteers have completed phase one of their plan to restore the dunes at a beloved beach in regional WA where four-wheel drives have destroyed parts of the unique habitat.

item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Rare photo captures Christmas Island flying fox ferrying pup
item.description: Often compared to a "teddy bear", advocates hope the special snap of an endangered flying fox carrying its pup will shine a light on the Christmas Island animal.

item.title: Takeaways from the many mentions of Donald Trump in newly released Epstein files
item.description: Donald Trump's name appears many times in the Epstein files — including on an FBI list of men who are named as subjects of "salacious information". So what have we learned about the US president?

item.title: Bright light blazing across Victorian skies believed to be Starlink satellite debris
item.description: Keen observers reported a "massive, bright orange meteor" streaking across the sky, but one astronomer says it was likely to be space debris from a Starlink satellite.

item.title: Sam Kerr is back for the Asian Cup, half a lifetime after winning it as a teenager
item.description: Matildas captain Sam Kerr was just 16 when she helped the team win the Women's Asian Cup — their first, and to date only major trophy. Now she's leading the side at home, ready for another shot at glory.

item.title: Wallabies Rugby World Cup matches revealed against All Blacks, Hong Kong China and Chile
item.description: Australia's home Rugby World Cup campaign will kick off against debutants Hong Kong China rather than bitter rivals New Zealand, who also feature in the same pool.

item.title: Nusantara Beat to bring 'psychedelic' take on Indonesian folk music to WOMADelaide
item.description: All members of Amsterdam-based band Nusantara Beat have Indonesian heritage, so what better way to connect with those roots than through a very different take on the archipelago's traditional music?

item.title: Model revealed for Thriving Kids, the NDIS alternative for some children with developmental delay or autism
item.description: The federal government has released the model for its Thriving Kids program, aimed at setting up services and supports run by states and territories outside the NDIS.

item.title: Police say Today show host Savannah Guthrie's mother has been abducted
item.description: Police have declared a crime scene after the mother of US TV personality Savannah Guthrie went missing from her home. Here's what we know.

item.title: Ley offers temporary exile for Nationals who breached shadow cabinet solidarity
item.description: Sussan Ley has given David Littleproud a list of non-negotiable conditions, which if accepted could see the Coalition reunited before the end of the week.

item.title: Bill and Hillary Clinton agree to testify before US House of Representatives on ties to Jeffrey Epstein
item.description: The decision could head off a planned vote in the Republican-led House of Representatives to hold the two prominent Democrats in contempt of Congress, which could potentially lead to criminal charges.

item.title: Greg Roser to serve life sentence as woodchipper murder appeal rejected
item.description: In 2022, Gregory Lee Roser was found guilty of murder after beating a man with a metal bar and then placing his body in a woodchipper.

item.title: Major potato company Zerella plans NT expansion with proposed Katherine seed farm
item.description: Potatoes have not been grown in the Northern Territory at commercial scale for many years but could change if a planned seed potato venture goes ahead.

item.title: Cadia goldmine faces Supreme Court class action over contamination claims
item.description: Landowners in central west NSW are behind an environmental class action against one of the world's biggest goldmines, alleging contamination of more than 2,000 properties.

item.title: Queensland land activation program lacks affordable homes mandate
item.description: There are no mandates for social or affordable homes in the Queensland state government's latest action to address the housing crisis.

item.title: NSW protest restrictions extended ahead of Israel president's visit
item.description: The NSW Police commissioner announces restrictions on protests will be extended, ahead of planned demonstrations against the upcoming Sydney visit of Israel's president.

item.title: Parents of Brooke Day, 22, preparing to bring daughter home after Japan ski lift death
item.description: The parents of a Queensland woman who died in a horror ski lift accident in Japan say she was an advanced snowboarder who had completed safety training.

item.title: One Nation SA candidate Cory Bernardi says party will be the 'strongest voice of opposition'
item.description: One Nation's lead candidate for South Australia Cory Bernardi has taken aim at the "two-party duopoly" in the state, with Pauline Hanson issuing a warning to Labor that her party would be "coming for your seats".

item.title: Canberra man pleads guilty to murdering partner who died from significant injuries in their home
item.description: A Canberra man pleads guilty to murdering his long-term partner on what was due to be the first day of his two-month long ACT Supreme Court trial.

item.title: Mortgage repayment calculator: How much extra you could be paying now the cash rate is 3.85 per cent
item.description: Tell us your loan size, term and interest rate, and our mortgage repayment calculator will work out how much extra you may have to pay on your loan.

item.title: RBA lifts interest rates by 0.25pc as inflation rises
item.description: RBA lifts interest rates by 0.25 per cent, to 3.85 per cent, after inflation rose "materially" in the second half of 2025.

item.title: South Sydney recruit David Fifita will lean on Wayne Bennett in an effort to rebuild his NRL career
item.description: After a season lost to injury, newly minted South Sydney backrower David Fifita will lean on Rabbitohs coach Wayne Bennett in an effort to reclaim his status as one of the NRL's most dangerous players.

item.title: Who is Deni Avdija? Israel's first NBA All-Star, who received a personal message from Benjamin Netanyahu
item.description: Deni Avdija's breakout season with the Portland Trail Blazers earns him an NBA All-Star nod as well as a message from Israel's president.

item.title: Treasurer asks ASIC to restrict public access to company directors' home addresses
item.description: The Australian Securities and Investments Commission moves to dramatically restrict public access to the residential addresses of company directors at the request of Treasurer Jim Chalmers.

item.title: Child safety officers took no action over 16-month-old’s worsening scabies, inquiry hears
item.description: A 16-month-old child with "persistent" scabies did not receive a medical diagnosis for up to eight months due to inaction by Queensland's child safety department, an inquiry has heard.

item.title: What I wish my manager knew about my mental health
item.description: I've spent my working life in what I like to call the "honesty gap". This kind of creative disclosure became a necessary art form to maintain my work life.

item.title: Perth man accused of backing Bondi attackers facing more firearms charges
item.description: A Perth man who allegedly stated support for the Bondi shooters appears in court to face new firearms charges, with his lawyer flagging a bail application.

item.title: Piper James's family arrives in Australia to farewell 19yo who died on K'gari
item.description: The parents and close friends of Piper James, 19, who died on K'gari (Fraser Island) last month, arrive in Australia to say their final farewells.

item.title: Missing bushwalker David Elliot found after large-scale search in the Blue Mountains
item.description: Authorities have found 71-year-old David Elliot alive following a multi-agency search when he failed to return from a 30-kilometre walk.

item.title: Federal parliament condemns attempted bombing at Perth/Boorloo Invasion Day rally
item.description: Federal parliament officially condemns the attempted bomb attack at Perth's Invasion Day rally on its first sitting day, acknowledging the harm caused to the First Nations community.

item.title: Australian Nurse working in Gaza for MSF says looming ban on aid organisation 'abandons' vulnerable
item.description: Broome nurse Rebecca Smith says a looming ban on Doctors Without Borders due to registration issues will harm the most needy patients.

item.title: Sydney Mardi Gras pulls plug on party weeks out from parade
item.description: Chief executive of the Sydney Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras, Jesse Matheson, announced the post-parade celebration will not go ahead.

item.title: Austin Appelbee speaks after 'superhuman' swim off Quindalup to save family in Geographe Bay
item.description: A WA mother says asking her teenage son to swim four kilometres through rough seas to get help after their family was swept out to sea, was "one of the hardest decisions" she has ever made.

item.title: 'Mass exodus' from Cambodian scam compounds a 'humanitarian crisis'
item.description: Cambodia has witnessed a "mass exodus" from the country's online scam operations in recent weeks amid growing international pressure and the extradition to China of an alleged kingpin.

item.title: 'Spas' and 'saunas' used to reintroduce green and golden bell frogs to the ACT in world-first trial
item.description: Scientists are reintroducing hundreds of green and golden bell frogs into the ACT, nearly 50 years after they became locally extinct.

item.title: Water Corporation makes 'error' in early publication of new desalination plant location in Albany
item.description: The long-anticipated decision on a site for a desalination plant near Albany has been shared on the Water Corporation's webpage in an "administrative error" ahead of the official announcement.

item.title: Nightmare on Martin Place as RBA outlines horror interest rates scenario
item.description: The good news is the economy ended 2025 in relatively good shape — with growth starting to pick up, the economy transitioning away from government-led spending, and a historically strong jobs market. Unfortunately, that's where it ends.

item.title: 13yo boy recounts swim through rough seas to help his family
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Two alleged Brothers 4 Life gang members charged with firearms offences
item.description: More than a decade after the gang wreaked havoc on Sydney's streets, two of its alleged members have been charged with firearms offences by the Raptor Squad.

item.title: Commonwealth, Westpac, NAB, ANZ respond to RBA's interest rate hike
item.description: The Commonwealth Bank responds to the Reserve Bank of Australia's decision to increase the cash rate.

item.title: Central Coast Mariners star Annalise Rasmussen signs with Italian powerhouse Juventus
item.description: A-League leading goal scorer Annalise Rasmussen leaves the competition immediately to join Italian powerhouse Juventus.

item.title: Commissioner slams attempts to use complex needs as 'justification' for Mosman Park murder-suicides
item.description: Australia's disability discrimination commissioner condemns "dangerous narratives" surrounding the deaths of teenage brothers Leon and Otis Clune, saying the burden of disability should never be a justification for family violence.

item.title: Foreign boat pictured in Queensland creek as alleged illegal fishers reach mainland
item.description: Breaches of Australia's northern border continue to escalate, with an alleged illegal fishing boat having been photographed deep inside a creek in Far North Queensland.

item.title: To stop the rate hikes, Chalmers might have to ditch the 'I didn't do it' game
item.description: When the news broke that rates would increase, the treasurer's main priority was to prove it wasn't his fault. That won't satisfy voters.

item.title: Tuesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: China bans hidden car door handles amid safety concerns
item.description: The hidden car door handles that have been popularised by Tesla will be banned from next year.

item.title: Russia resumes strikes on Ukraine, leaving hundreds of thousands without heating in freezing temperatures
item.description: The 71 missiles and 450 drones came a day before Ukrainian and Russian negotiators were due to meet for a second round of talks in Abu Dhabi.

item.title: French police raid X offices in Paris as Elon Musk ordered to face questions
item.description: A widening probe into the social media platform is investigating alleged abuse of algorithms and fraudulent data extraction.

item.title: Luxury Gnarabup Development granted approval by WA Environment Minister Matthew Swinbourn
item.description: A controversial $138 million luxury resort slated for construction in WA's South West is given a long-anticipated green light by the state's environment minister.

item.title: Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez announces plans to ban social media access for under-16s
item.description: The Spanish PM said his government would begin the process of passing legislation from as early as next week.

item.title: Battery demand 'straps on a rocket' as rooftop solar passes its peak
item.description: Even as Australia appears to have passed the peak of solar uptake, demand for batteries is seemingly headed into orbit.

item.title: Australian freestyle skier Laura Peel hurts knee in Winter Olympics training camp
item.description: Australian freestyle skier Laura Peel hurt her knee in a training camp ahead of the Milan Cortina Winter Olympics, raising doubts about her participation in a fourth Games.

item.title: Poland to probe links between Epstein and Russian intelligence
item.description: Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk says the step has been taken amid growing speculation that "this unprecedented paedophilia scandal was co-organised by Russian intelligence services".

item.title: Son of Norway's crown princess tells rape trial sex was consensual
item.description: Marius Borg Høiby pleads not guilty to four counts of rape and one of domestic violence but guilty to a count of offensive sexual behaviour.

item.title: UK police open criminal investigation into politician Peter Mandelson over links to Jeffrey Epstein
item.description: The former UK ambassador to the US will retire from Britain's parliament as police open a criminal investigation over his ties to the late paedophile.

item.title: Officers find signs of forced entry at home of TV host Savannah Guthrie's mother
item.description: Investigators reportedly found evidence of a deliberate night-time kidnapping at the property.

item.title: Melbourne lord mayor calls on governments to manage environmental consequences of data centre boom
item.description: Melbourne's lord mayor has called on governments to better manage the environmental consequences of the state's growing data centres, warning their development has the potential to "cook the planet".

item.title: Thousands of parents seek support as children cannot go to school
item.description: Thousands of Australian parents are struggling with children who cannot go to school. A new podcast and e-book have been released to help support them.

item.title: RBA rate hike highlights plight of borrowers versus boomers
item.description: A third of Australians could benefit if banks raise deposit rates on savings, while mortgage holders are having to decide what to cut back on.

item.title: What could the government do to help battle inflation?
item.description: The federal government has a variety of options available if it wants to do more to stave off inflation, but none are popular.

item.title: Elite women athletes finding ways to work smarter, to help sporting and professional careers
item.description: The sport-work-life balance is a struggle faced by many female athletes, but many are finding meaningful ways to diversify their income to secure their future.

item.title: SA Liberals face three major threats in One Nation, a popular premier and independents
item.description: While South Australia is considered a more moderate state than Queensland or New South Wales, March's state election will still be a chance to gauge the seriousness of One Nation's polling surge and the impact of the Coalition split on the Liberal Party's brand.

item.title: US forces shoot down Iranian drone near American warship
item.description: The US military has shot down an Iranian drone that was flying towards an American aircraft carrier in waters near Iran, US authorities say.

item.title: More than 1.5m AI bots are now socialising on Moltbook — but experts say that's not the scary part
item.description: A social network run entirely by AI bots has attracted more than a million users — but experts warn it is not what the bots are saying that poses the true risk.

item.title: Brisbane 2032 looking to learn from Milano Cortina Olympics as costs of dispersed Games start to bite
item.description: Brisbane 2032 president Andrew Liveris says the bid budget "bears no resemblance to reality" as the financial impact of a dispersed Olympics hits home.

item.title: How to know if you're experiencing PTSD
item.description: Louise was experiencing nightmares for five years before being diagnosed with post-traumatic stress disorder.

item.title: LIV Golf members to start receiving Official World Golf Ranking points
item.description: Members of the LIV Golf league will receive points toward the Official World Golf Ranking system on a limited basis, the OWGR governing body has announced.

item.title: Sydney students tackle climate change livability as world records hottest three years
item.description: The designs include cooling devices for street lights, air-purifying pods for train stations and re-imagined bus shelters to improve livability, after the world records its hottest three years ever.

item.title: Calls for mandatory fire sprinklers in Specialist Disability Accommodation
item.description: Around the country, people with disability are over-represented in house fire deaths. One simple change could make all the difference.

item.title: Boost for development of low-emissions alternatives to glass wine bottles
item.description: The federal government provides $2 million towards developing low-emissions alternatives to glass wine bottles using materials like seaweed and plant sugar.

item.title: What the Epstein files tell us about Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor's 'car crash' 2019 interview
item.description: Documents released last week have shed more light on what the former prince might have been lying about in that fateful sit-down with the BBC's flagship current affairs program, Newsnight.

item.title: Formula 1 driver Jack Doohan signs with Haas as reserve driver after leaving Alpine
item.description: Former Alpine racer Jack Doohan signed with Haas as a reserve driver for the 2026 Formula 1 season.

item.title: Police search for two men who slashed teen and ran him over in St Kilda
item.description: Two men described by police as acting like "rabid dogs" are on the run after allegedly slashing a teenager with a knife and running him over in an incident in Melbourne on Tuesday night.

item.title: Otways residents burnt out of their 'paradise' determined to rebuild home
item.description: The Cochrane family has called the Otways home for more than four decades. Even after fires destroyed their property, they do not plan to move.

item.title: Live: Ley rejects 'ridiculous' speculation she could be deposed within weeks
item.description: Sussan Ley has rejected speculation she could be deposed as Liberal leader within weeks as "ridiculous". Follow live.

item.title: Sixth man charged in 'satanic' child abuse material ring probe, further 145 alleged offenders identified
item.description: Another man has been charged and a further 145 alleged offenders have been referred to international law enforcement agencies as part of an investigation into a satanic child sex abuse material ring.

item.title: Sarah Ferguson offered Jeffrey Epstein woman with 'great body' after his release from prison
item.description: Emails contained in the Epstein files show former British royal Sarah Ferguson told the convicted child sex offender she knew a "single" woman with a "great body" he should meet, weeks after his 2009 release from prison.

item.title: Fire breaks out after alleged ram raid north of Melbourne
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Brazen ram raid and fire at Mooroopna gift shop caught on camera
item.description: Police have released footage of a ram raid and fire at a gift shop in the regional town of Mooroopna near Shepparton, north of Melbourne.

item.title: Donald Trump says Republicans should 'nationalise' US elections
item.description: Donald Trump says he wants Republicans to "nationalise" US elections and has encouraged his party to "take over the voting" in at least some parts of the country.

item.title: Extreme heat will make Northern Territory unlivable within 40 years, activists warn
item.description: The Climate Justice Alliance says rising temperatures and increasingly severe heatwaves present a direct and immediate threat to people across the Territory, particularly in the Top End.

item.title: Jill Biden's first husband charged with killing wife in domestic dispute at Delaware home
item.description: William Stevenson is charged with the murder of his wife, Linda Stevenson, at their Delaware home on December 28.

item.title: Dr Karl's How Things Work quiz: How much do you really know about guitars?
item.description: From shaping to tuning — how much do you know about how an acoustic guitar is made?

item.title: 'Rogue' tour guides threaten Gold Coast glow-worm population
item.description: Last year two operators were fined for running glow-worm cave tours in the Springbrook and Tamborine national parks without the required permits.

item.title: Live: Tech sell-off drives Wall Street lower as bitcoin crashes below $US73,000
item.description: The Australian share market is likely to fall in morning trade after a brutal session on Wall Street, weighed down by massive losses in the share prices of tech and AI companies like Nvidia and Microsoft, while bitcoin has plunged to a 16-month low. Follow live.

item.title: Australia knocked out of under-19 Cricket World Cup by England
item.description: Ollie Peake's hobbling and defiant captain's knock of 100 has proved too little too late to rescue Australia as their reign as under-19 World Cup champions was ended by England in a compelling semifinal in Zimbabwe.

item.title: Flood-hit family living in caravan and shed during blistering Thargomindah summer
item.description: Melinda Byrne and her family lost their home when a flood raged through Thargomindah less than a year ago. Trying to rebuild while living in a caravan they've been forced to endure temperatures higher than 45C.

item.title: Deep Creek blaze destroys 'at least one structure' as CFS battles wind changes
item.description: A bushfire on South Australia's Fleurieu Peninsula has now burnt more than 2,500 hectares, with the CFS saying it believes "at least one structure" has been lost in the blaze.

item.title: Forestry industry sounds alarm over 'cheap' timber imports landing in Australia and threatening jobs
item.description: Imported timber is coming into Australia at nearly half the price of domestically manufactured products and is increasingly being used in local homes.
